item.title: Did you know...you can change the default file encoding for new query on SSMS?
item.description: If you have been reading my last blog posts, you know that I’m currently working on a SQL code migration from Firebird to SQL Server. The client provided the scripts with all modules (Stored Procedures, functions, etc) and the steps I’m following (roughly speaking) for converting are: On this process, the unicode characters are replaced by some symbols. We can change the default file encoding in order to be the one we want in the first place.
